input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve just been feeling really tired all the time, and I get these weird fevers that come and go. And, um, lately, I’ve been having these strange feelings in my leg, like it’s not quite right, and my head has been kind of foggy.
output:
THINKING: The patient reports new symptoms including persistent fatigue, intermittent fevers, abnormal sensations in the leg, and cognitive fog. These are all new clinical details since the previous summarized vignette.  
ANSWER: The patient reports feeling really tired all the time, experiencing weird fevers that come and go, having strange feelings in the leg, and feeling foggy in the head.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve just been feeling really tired all the time, and I get these weird fevers that come and go. And, um, lately, I’ve been having these strange feelings in my leg, like it’s not quite right, and my head has been kind of foggy.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how your symptoms have been affecting your daily life, and if you’ve noticed anything that makes your feelings better or worse?
PATIENT: Um, well, it’s been pretty hard to do things like I used to. I get tired easily and sometimes I forget things or feel a bit dizzy, especially when my head hurts. I notice I get worse if I try to do too much, but I haven’t really figured out what makes it better, honestly.
output:
THINKING: The patient has presented new symptoms that include ongoing fatigue, intermittent fevers, abnormal sensations in the leg, and cognitive fog, which are all new details since the last summary.  
ANSWER: The patient reports feeling really tired all the time, experiencing weird fevers that come and go, having strange feelings in the leg, and feeling foggy in the head.
